title: 5 Hacks To Style Your Overgrown Bangs
text:
facebook 
We have to agree that bangs can elevate any look instantly. But though they look chic, they can be high maintenance as they grow out quickly and need to be trimmed to not make you look like a shaggy rag doll. But, if you are growing out your bangs, or are just too busy to go for a trim, here are five hacks to make your styling easier. Twist them on the side 
One of the easiest ways to deal with overgrown bangs is to twist them slightly, and pin it on one side using a hair accessory for a vintage look. Coif them 
Back comb your bangs slightly, and pin them back on your crown to add some volume to your hair. Wear a headband 
If the bangs are falling on your eyes constantly, then its best to use a headband that will keep those pesky strands in check, and will also give you a polished look. Slick them back 
The sleek hair trend is in. So, you can slick back your bangs with some smoothening serum and medium hold spray, or you can tie them in a low ponytail to channel a nonchalant vibe. Braid it
